importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame marks the day of the dismissal, highlighting that the decision was made immediately after a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea.

keyTakeAways: Ange Postecoglou was dismissed by Nottingham Forest after just 39 days as head coach, making it the fastest managerial exit in Premier League history.
Postecoglou failed to win any of his 9 matches, drawing two and losing six, with no wins in his tenure.
The club confirmed the dismissal in a statement released within 20 minutes of the match ending.
This is the shortest tenure of a manager in Premier League history, beating previous records.
Postecoglou joined after Nuno Espírito Santo, who had led the team to a seventh-place finish — the best in 30 years.
The departure followed a poor run of results, including a 3-0 loss to Chelsea, and a strained relationship with owner Evangelos Marinakis, which may have contributed to the decision.
The club has now appointed its third manager in the season, signaling instability in leadership.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ange Postecoglou, the Australian football manager, was dismissed by Nottingham Forest just 39 days after being appointed, following a string of poor results including a 3-0 loss to Chelsea. This marks the fastest managerial exit in Premier League history, surpassing Les Reed’s previous record. Postecoglou's tenure was defined by zero wins, two draws, and six losses, with fans booing him at the final match. He joined the club after Nuno Espírito Santo’s departure, who had led the team to its best league finish in 30 years. The club is now seeking its third manager of the season, highlighting instability in leadership.
title: Nottingham Forest manager Ange Postecoglou fired after just 39 days at Premier League club
